translation2: All Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools are carefully inspected, tested, and subjected to strict controls by the Bosch quality assurance. Therefore, Bosch provides a guarantee for Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools. The warranty claims of the buyer from the purchase contract with the seller, as well as legal rights, are not restricted by this guarantee. For these tools, we provide warranty according to the following conditions: We provide warranty according to the provisions of the following regulations (Nos. 2-7) by repairing the defective tool free of charge, which can be proven to have arisen within the warranty period due to a material or manufacturing defect. The warranty period is 24 months for private use, 12 months for commercial or professional use or equivalent wear and tear. The warranty period begins with the purchase by the first buyer. The decisive date is the date on the original purchase receipt. For all tools purchased from September 1, 2004 onwards, which are intended for professional use and are blue (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery-powered screwdrivers, and pneumatic tools), the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the buyer registers the tools within 4 weeks of the purchase date. Battery packs and chargers, as well as accessories delivered with the tools, are excluded from this extended warranty. Registration can only be made online at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). The confirmation of registration is the registration receipt, which must be printed immediately, as well as the original purchase receipt, which shows the date of purchase. Registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of his data there. Excluded from the warranty are: parts that are subject to normal wear and tear, as well as defects in the tool that are due to normal use, unusual environmental conditions, unusual operating conditions, overloading, or insufficient maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of non-Bosch accessory parts, replacement parts, or spare parts. Tools that have undergone modifications or additions. Minor deviations from the specified condition that are insignificant for the value and usability of the tool. The removal of the defect recognized by us as warranty-worthy is carried out in such a way that we repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a flawless tool (possibly also a subsequent model) at our discretion. Replaced tools or parts become our property.
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is mostly fluent with minor errors that do not impede understanding. The use of passive voice and the switch from 'we' to 'us' is a bit inconsistent ('we provide warranty' vs 'carried out by us'). The phrase 'removal of the defect recognized by us as warranty-worthy' might be better phrased as 'repair of the issue that we recognize as covered by our warranty'. Also, the repeated use of the full phrase 'Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools.' might be improved by rephrasing to prevent redundancy." } }

translation2: Tire Choice for Racing Bikes - Really That Safe? I've been eagerly awaiting today, because I wanted to prepare for my upcoming cycling tour next week by at least a little bit of training. Said and done, and I went out on my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay. The first 40km were great too - but then what happened, what lurks in every city center (this time: Thanks Krefeld!) happened. Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing and my rear tire didn't want to continue the rest of the route on no account. Since I couldn't really get a replacement tire and tube on Wednesday due to the day of the week, I had to turn around with half-hearted mood and take the first train home. It wasn't quite as bad weather-wise, maybe it's better if I practice the tire change before the tour. Now I stand before a question and hope that you can help me. Since I have a relatively long route over several days ahead of me, I would extremely unwillingly have this problem again and again. Now it wasn't really bad, because also the old tires from the previous owner (very nice old man, who had driven 140km on the day I picked up the bike until 14:12!) and he also already described them as suboptimal because he had driven with them for years. But if I think about the fact that I have to change the tire after 80-90km, then I'm afraid I'm really in a bad mood :D Now I've had a conversation with an older man at the platform who asked me why I didn't have Marathon Plus tires; these are supposed to be unbreakable. That sounds very tempting. But are they really that indestructible? I don't want to spend 40€/tire now to find out that I'm disappointed. I continue to wonder: I currently have 25x622 on my bike, which is apparently also available (apparently?) with Marathon Plus tires, but the majority is already wider. Is this a problem? Or would you advise me to other tires with a racing bike in general? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute! My knowledge of the topic is rather in favor of the Durano DD. Thank you already in advance for the help and warm greetings!
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent, with no grammatical errors, unnatural wording, or stiff syntax. The author uses various complex sentences and advanced vocabulary appropriately. translation2: "The party we wanted to throw": Frankfurt celebrates after a torrid comeback against Leverkusen What a spectacular reaction from Eintracht Frankfurt. After 22 minutes, the last time they won twice in a row, it seemed that the Hesse were on their way to another Bundesliga failure. But then the SGE turned it around, shot off their frustration over a mediocre season start within an hour and won wildly with 5:2. "It's crazy what the guys have done today," jubiled coach Oliver Glasner to DAZN and gave a "general compliment to everyone who was there," expressing admiration for their performance. It initially looked like another dampener for the Frankfurt team, who are still behind their expectations in ninth place. Patrik Schick had given Leverkusen a 2-0 lead. But what happened next impressed even the SGE coach. "How the players came back and showed a fantastic performance," Glasner continued. I am crazy happy with the performance we showed and of course with the result. Even defender Christopher Lenz, who was able to play again for the first time since the fourth game week and his injured muscle, emphasized the morale of his teammates. "I believe our mentality is incredible," said the 27-year-old and was particularly pleased for the fans with the result. That was the party we wanted to throw. But for the upcoming tasks, Glasner wants to keep the focus on himself, and he feels well prepared in terms of personnel. It is extraordinary that all players are fit in December and in top physical condition. It is top work in our medical department, but the players also live highly professionally. Now you want to "take it step by step and stay humble" and go through the tasks until the end of the year "at this level." The next game is already scheduled for Wednesday, as part of the English week, an away game at Borussia Mönchengladbach (18:30, Sky).

translation2: Problems with Fiber Optic Cable + Devolo dLan/Magic  We have had a new fiber optic connection in the house for a few weeks now. Unfortunately, I am now having problems building a stable Wi-Fi network. Before that, I had a DSL 50 Mbit connection and used Devolo dLan, which worked flawlessly with a few exceptions, receiving and transmitting 50 Mbit. The new fiber optic connection sends 500 Mbit to the FritzBox 7590 and the dLan module connected to it, but these speeds are also reduced at the other dLan module, which is used to transmit Wi-Fi. The further I move away from this module with the device, the less speed I get (so use a power outlet that is 1, 2, 3, etc. rooms away from the other module). This leads to the fact that the Internet with the new fiber optic connection is now even slower on the first floor than before (~45 Mbit). I have also ordered a new Devolo Magic Set, which apparently uses a new technology. This was slightly better than the dLan, but there were also similar losses here. Can someone explain to me why so much internet speed is lost over the power line with fiber optic cable? And is LAN really the only solution? It would be extremely expensive to re-route LAN cables throughout the house. I am really at a loss, which is why I have created an account here. Therefore, I would be even more grateful for a response.

translation2: Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, which among other things led to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the "Valve Reactor" circuit, which perfectly imitates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X Amps, we are presenting a brand new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers wait with an authenticity that is absolutely impressive. Of course, these amps also feature the multi-stage Valvetronix tube preamplifier, which partly relies on real analog circuits because these are better at capturing the variations and nuances of a tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuit, the VTX amplifiers also offer a closed housing and a bass reflex system, from which the natural resonances just flow. With the "Tone Room" software from VOX, you can even correct and bend historical facts on the virtual level, so that the amp and effects sound exactly as you have always imagined it. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is primarily due to the 2001 introduced VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to also meet new sound requirements, which led to another performance boost of the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 - with more dynamics as well as numerous and decisively improved amplifier models. From the compact VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has also been designed in such a way that all guitarists looking for maximum sound diversity will find what they're looking for. All guitarists dream of the pressure and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, as well as prompt response. During an in-depth analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the output stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding. The Valve Reactor circuit of each VT+ amplifier, equipped with a 12AX7 tube, perfectly reproduces the behavior, subtle nuances, and sound character of a tube amplifier.
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent. It employs appropriate terminology fitting its subject matter, and allows for easy reading and comprehension. translation2: Federal Minister of Housing Klara Geywitz (SPD): Expropriation does not create any new apartments The new Federal Minister of Housing, Klara Geywitz (SPD), has spoken out against the expropriation of large apartment corporations, as it has been demanded in a referendum in Berlin. "With expropriation, no single new apartment is created, it only changes the ownership structure," said Geywitz in an interview with the "Tagesspiegel" (Sunday). My goal is to give tenants security that their rent will remain affordable in the coming years. A colorful mix of private landlords, cooperatives, or housing associations, for example, is actually the best protection against monopolization. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens, and Left Party plans to set up an expert commission, as with the results of the referendum. However, if the situation does not calm down, Geywitz has just spoken with the FDP in the traffic light coalition about further tightening of the rental law. The coalition agreement provides for a rent brake until 2029, a limit on rent increases in tense housing markets, and the expansion of the rent index. I will discuss this with the Justice Minister as soon as possible. If the rental market does not calm down, "we will discuss further steps with our coalition partners," emphasized the SPD politician.

translation2: Rotating brake rotors are designed for the demands of the dynamic driver, who knows how to assess reliability and safety during braking even under difficult conditions. Rotating brake rotors are manufactured by casting and then machined (bored and cut). All tuned rotors are produced in short series according to individual technical properties, which are specific to certain rotors and patterns. Based on the individual technical drawing, a special production program is created that aligns with the enlargement of the rotor after the properties of the original mounting. The thus produced tuned rotors ensure high comfort and braking effectiveness. The aesthetic properties of our tuned rotors emphasize the attractive and striking appearance of each car, highlighting the character of each vehicle.

Basketball Bundesliga: Derby Disaster of the MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg against the Merlins Crailsheim At least youngster Johannes Patrick was left out. Again nothing: For the second time within less than three months, the Riesen lost in Crailsheim - and how! Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach John Patrick looked back on the cup defeat in October at the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim and said: "We still have some anger in our stomachs." But that anger didn't subside after the game - it even increased due to the 61:72 (28:38) loss in the Basketball Bundesliga. Whereas the result alone was enough to disappoint, the way the Riesen performed was even more disappointing. A statistic that expresses the entire dilemma: The three-point percentage was just 13%, 4 shots (all by young Johannes Patrick) out of 31 attempts - more questions? John Patrick's answer was: "We weren't concentrated enough after our win in Tenerife and didn't implement what we had trained." In other words, moving the ball. Sebastian Gleim, his opponent, had a completely different reaction: "It was a great game to win for the second time against Ludwigsburg," said the happy coach. "It felt like we were playing in front of 10,000 people." There were only 750 spectators in the Hohenlohe Arena on Saturday, but they made the most of it. Not least because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who scored 22 points and led his team's game. "The best playmaker I've ever trained," praised Gleim. Meanwhile, the performance leaders in Patrick's team, such as Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7), failed on the entire court. Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the Riesen avoid a total debacle and came within eight points of a comeback, after they had already trailed 39:59. Along with Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon scored 12 points. Luckily, there's not much time left to worry. The Riesen receive the Skyliners Frankfurt on Wednesday (7:19 pm), and even in Ludwigsburg, there will be a maximum of 750 spectators.

In the name of the people: lay judges sit in everyday clothes on the bench in the courtroom. But much depends on their judgment, even if they do not wear a robe: lay assessors determine with professional judges whether and for how long someone goes behind bars. Two of them report in conversation with the "Public" about their time at the Bad Kreuznacher Landgericht: Sascha Wickert from Boos and Ruth Ertz from Bad Kreuznach are two of the 125 lay judges at the Landgericht an der John-F.-Kennedy-Straße.

I find it generally unfair to expect children to take on the role of parents for their younger siblings. However, I do think it's good for older siblings to take care of their younger siblings to some extent. They can take turns keeping an eye on them, helping out, and even bringing them a drink, for example. This way, they learn responsibility, help out in the family, and feel included. As long as they are still capable of taking care of themselves, I don't see a problem with it. If your K1 is occupied for a short time and it's okay for him, that's fine. You can best assess whether it's suitable for your children. It's not like he has to take care of K2 all the time and stay with him until he falls asleep. Legally, it may be questionable. Perhaps that's why the psychologist's statement comes into play. If something were to happen like a fire, burglary, earthquake, alien invasion, etc., it would be too much responsibility for K1 to take care of K2. Whether you want to take that risk is, of course, up to you :)

translation2: A new 110-kV earth cable will be built in 2022. The permission for the laying of the new high-voltage cable at Tann is legally valid. The plan approval decision of the government of Lower Bavaria makes the way for the construction, which is scheduled to start in 2022. This was now announced by the network operator Bayernwerk. The approximately seven-kilometer-long earth cable will connect the transformer station Tann in the northern part of the community and the existing 110-kilovolt line between Simbach and Pfarrkirchen. The cable will be connected to a transmission tower of the overhead line near the village of Edermanning near Reut.

translation2: Heavy "Huidlerer" question: The Amberg man knows the solution What please is an "Huidlerer"? With this dialect word, sent by an Amberg man, heated thinking has been aroused in the BR television show "We in Bavaria". But unlike on many previous days, the term "Host mi?" this time remained unguessed by the callers. No, it was not a "person who is nervous". And neither was it "one who everything has to go quickly for". That, the people heard from the TV moderator, was completely wrong. Whereupon the man from Amberg revealed the solution and thus probably also surprised many Upper Palatinate people. "The Huidlerer", the viewers learned, "is a cloth used to wipe the oven". Dialectologist Antony Rowley, who has been consulted by Bavarian Television for years as an expert, confirmed this. With the remark that this is a typical Upper Palatinate term, derived somehow from the better known dialect word "Houdern". With which a gap in education was closed - perhaps also for many who have been living in the Amberg area for a long time.

translation2: Friedrich Wins 60th World Cup Victory - Nolte Wins Two-Man Bob - Sport  The brand of the Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 victories is the goal of the bobsled pilot. "I've calculated it, I would need to win nine and a half races per season to make it to Cortina 2026," said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who scored two victories in two days of racing in Winterberg. First, he fended off an attack by Johannes Lochner by five hundredths of a second, overtaking him from third to first. Then he made some changes to the equipment settings and posted a larger lead of 0.30 seconds on Sunday. With his teammates Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg), and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he beat the British Brad Hall. Third place went to Austrian Benjamin Maier. "We took a bigger risk today and were rewarded," said Friedrich, who also scored his 22nd consecutive victory. The Stuttgart-based Berchtesgadener Johannes Lochner finished fifth after placing second earlier. Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach landed in eighth place after finishing fourth in the first race. "If I knew what he was doing differently, I would do the same," said Lochner.  Nolte Wins Home Race - Podium for Jamanka  At the women's event, Laura Nolte won her third season victory in the two-man bob on her home track. After finishing fourth in the monobob the day before, she raced to the World Cup victory with her pusher Deborah Levi on Sunday. Two-man bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thüringen finished second with Germany's fastest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen. Jamanka also qualified for the Olympics with her performance, scoring her first podium finish this winter. Wiesbadener Kim Kalicki finished third with Leonie Fiebig. "It was super cool to get my first podium in the World Cup," said Burghardt, emphasizing that it's not just about pushing, but there's also a lot to do around it. Jamanka was a bit frustrated with the not entirely flawless runs, but said, "It's going in the right direction."

translation2: By clicking the button, you can easily choose whether your "Smart Stone" should permanently glow in one color or cycle through its entire color palette. When faced with a color change, the light stone retains a light color for around a minute before gently transitioning to the next decorative color tone. The solid construction of the "Smart Stone" lamp ensures that it lasts all year round in the open air. Even in snowy environments, its light shines particularly well - the only drawback is a shorter light duration when the days are shorter. Please note that in winter, snow should not be allowed to obstruct the solar module in its function. "Smart Stone" uses a NiMh battery in the Mignon (AA) format, which can be easily replaced if necessary. You can order a suitable replacement battery through our webshop and thus further extend the operating life of your decorative lamp.
